titlestmt.titleproper: Indiana University Press mss. II, ca. 1950-1969

note.p: © 2010 Trustees of Indiana University. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation:
XML finding aid derived from HTML version through cutting and pasting
2010
Finding aid encoded by Matt Carruthers, Library/Archives, Indiana University, March 24, 2010

change.item: This is the first version of the encoded finding aid.

did.head: Summary Information
did.abstract: The Indiana University Press mss. II, ca. 1950-1969, consists of the office and correspondence files of the press from its establishment in 1950.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Founded in 1950 in Bloomington, Indiana, the Indiana University Press is a an academic publisher specializing in the humanities and social sciences. The majority of publications emphasize scholarship, but the the press also publishes text, trade, and reference titles.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into the following series: I. Author correspondence; II. Distributors and press representatives; III. Sales; IV. Miscellaneous.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Indiana University Press mss. II, ca. 1950-1969, consists of the office and correspondence files of the press from its establishment in 1950. The Author series contains mostly correspondence with or about authors and concerning specific books, though a few files are listed by book project. Other materials in the collection include correspondence with sales distributors, publisher representatives and salesmen. The overall arrangement is as it was maintained at the press offices.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Prior arrangements are not necessary before coming to the Library, however, patrons from out of town are encouraged to communicate with the Library in advance of their visits to ascertain availability of materials.
Photocopying permitted only with permission of the Curator of Manuscripts, Lilly Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Indiana University Press mss. II, Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by author, followed by several miscellaneous files and a chronological section mostly concerning rejected books.
